objects.description: Extracts named entities from input text. For example input: Microsoft is headquartered at Redmond the output is org: Microsoft. Here Microsoft is recognized as an organization. Similarly the library can recognize common things such as nationalities, location, buildings, people, events, money, quantity etc.

pipeline_modules.description: This implementation is based on a fast, free and open-source library called Spacy

pipeline_modules.cons: relatively more expensive, involves an external call, entity coverage is not consistent
pipeline_modules.description: This is a paid service by dandelion.eu
pipeline_modules.pros: contextual, slightly higher accuracy, improves over time

pipeline_modules.cons: Data flows out of IMIbot.Adds to the bot's cost and latency
pipeline_modules.pros: Good accuracy in intent recognition.Less code to be written locally

pipeline_modules.cons: Data flows out of IMIbot.Adds to the bot's cost and latency

objects.description: This module helps extract units from text input

This module takes an image url as an input and returns the text detected in the image as response. The image_type parameter which captures the type of the image being fed as input can take the following values:natural_imageTo be used if the input image contains objects in addition to text.document.To be used if OCR needs to be performed on structured documents.

pipeline_modules.cons: slightly expensive, sometimes presents with spacing issues in the detected text
pipeline_modules.pros: text recognition accuarcy is pretty good even for images with bad lighting conditions, supports multiple languages, supports automatic language detection from image

objects.description: Converts a paragraph into an array of sentences.

pipeline_modules.description: A suite of libraries and programs for symbolic and statistical NLP for English written in the Python
pipeline_modules.pros: free, greater flexibility,no external calls, supports multiple languages

pipeline_modules.cons: comparatively lesser flexibility, opinionated, only supports English

objects.description: Takes an audio url and the language code as inputs and converts the recorded speech in the audio to text.

pipeline_modules.pros: Supports all the popular languages, great accuracy

objects.description: This module picks and classifies entities from input text to predefined, custom entity classes.For example, if the bot developer has defined a custom entity called Metal and provided the values gold, sliver and platinum to it and a bot user enters the string Gold prices have declined. Then the bot pipeline module output for this text would recognize Gold as entity type Metal.
Detects if the input phrase falls under any of a large category set of small talk or commone sense intents like greetings, abuse, etc. The module also suggests an appropriate response.
Parses a given sentence into an array of individual words (tokens).

pipeline_modules.cons: comparatively lesser flexibility, opinionated, only supports English
pipeline_modules.description: This implementation is based on a fast, free and open-source library

pipeline_modules.pros: free, greater flexibility,no external calls, supports multiple languages

objects.description: Checks for mispelt words in a given sentence and sends the sentence back with those words corrected to the most likely right words.

pipeline_modules.cons: relatively more expensive, involves an external call, slightly slower
pipeline_modules.description: This is a Microsoft service and involves an external API call. It is machine learning based and is contextual.
pipeline_modules.pros: contextual, slightly higher accuracy, improves over time
cheaper, no external call, slightly faster

objects.description: This API translates text from the source to the target language.
Generates a grammatical dependency graph or parse tree of a given sentence using the standard spacy vocabulary nomenclature.

objects.description: This module helps retrieve phrases from input text

pipeline_modules.pros: cheaper, no external call, slightly faster

objects.description: Parses a given sentence for a mention of a number or a numeric quantity and extracts it in the response.

pipeline_modules.description: Parses a given sentence for a mention of one or more of the following metrics and the corresponding unit of measurement used.Metrics currently supported:Distance,Volume,CurrencyEach metric can be looked for individually by using the name of that metric as the library in the request body. If you use botman as the library, the module scans for all the supported metrics.
pipeline_modules.pros: cheaper, no external call, slightly faster

pipeline_modules.description: Number detection for 6 languages - english,hindi,gujarati,marathi,tamil and bengali
